snippet: In a characteristically pragmatic move, Pete Wilson today chose a state Senator noted for his fund-raising abilities to succeed him in the United States Senate when he is sworn in as Governor of California next Monday.   Mr. Wilson's successor, Jo...
lead_paragraph: In a characteristically pragmatic move, Pete Wilson today chose a state Senator noted for his fund-raising abilities to succeed him in the United States Senate when he is sworn in as Governor of California next Monday. Mr. Wilson's successor, John F. Seymour, a 53-year-old moderate Republican from Orange County who made his fortune as a real estate entrepreneur, was praised today by the Governor-elect for the "intelligence, energy and toughness of mind that made him a millionaire in business before he was 30 years old."

headline.main: New Senator From California Is Named

byline.original: By JANE GROSS, Special to The New York Times
